title: Gulf states’ inactive, uncapped oil and gas wells a $30 billion liability
description: The good news? Big oil companies are on the hook for the costs.

title: US senators call Tesla’s safety review a “sham,” demand answers from Musk
description: Senators accuse Tesla of hiding “untold number” of complaints.

title: After 18 months, GitHub’s big code search overhaul is generally available
description: The technical preview that started in December is now available to everyone.

title: Next-gen Apple Watch will reportedly get its first major CPU upgrade in years
description: The chip's new CPU will reportedly be based on the Apple A15 instead of the A13.

title: Musk issues ultimatum to inactive Twitter users: Log in or be purged
description: "We cannot release inactive usernames at this time," Twitter's policy still says.

title: Nintendo, ticked by Zelda leaks, does a DMCA run on Switch emulation tools
description: One Switch key-dumping project is still up, but an Android emulator is down.

title: Twitter fails to remove, label graphic images after Texas mass shooting
description: Feds found that Texas shooter shared "neo-Nazi views" on social media.

title: White House challenges hackers to break top AI models at DEF CON 31
description: The "largest-ever" AI red team will seek flaws in OpenAI, Google, Anthropic language models.

title: Gene editing makes bacteria-killing viruses even more deadly
description: The viruses are engineered to damage essential E coli. genes.

title: Trinity Test is front and center in trailer for Christopher Nolan’s Oppenheimer
description: "We're in a race against the Nazis, and I know what it means if the Nazis have a bomb."

title: Welcome to Normal: The town that holds the keys to Rivian’s future
description: Cash-burning EV startup recruits workers in central Illinois pursuing 50,000-delivery goal.

title: Former head of Roscosmos now thinks NASA did not land on the Moon
description: The Soviets were actually orbiting the Moon when Apollo 11 landed.

title: Passwordless Google accounts are easier and more secure than passwords. Here’s why.
description: The passkey ecosystem is far from complete, but Google's implementation is now ready to use.

title: Volkswagen’s troubled software division is getting new leadership. Again.
description: Bentley's Peter Bosch will move over to run Cariad, according to reports.

title: Darkest Dungeon 2 is an awkward sequel, but I can’t stop playing it
description: Now a roguelite, the game retains series' intoxicating combat and stylish flair.
